Configure Conditional Formatting

opt_condformat.Rd

Define conditional formatting rules that are evaluated in the browser. Each rule targets a column and applies a style when the condition is met.

Usage

opt_condformat(w, ..., rules = NULL, edit = FALSE)

Arguments

w

A lumina widget

...

Rule definitions as lists. Each rule can include:

  • column: Column name to target (required)

  • op: Comparison operator. One of "gt", "gte", "lt", "lte", "eq", "neq", "between", "contains", "in". Default: "eq".

  • value: Single value for comparisons (numeric or character). For between, use range or a length-2 vector. For in, use values.

  • range: Length-2 numeric vector for the between operator.

  • values: Vector of values for the in operator.

  • target: "cell" (default) or "row" to apply styles to the entire row.

  • style: List of CSS styles, e.g. list(bg="#fff3e0", color="#e65100", fontWeight="bold", textDecoration="underline", border="1px solid #e0e0e0", class="my-custom-class").

rules

Optional list of rules (useful when you already have them assembled). If omitted, rules are built from ....
